1.text: Pick up dry ice at your local grocery or general merchandise store.

2.text: Buy dry ice in block form.

3.text: Place the dry ice in an insulated container like a plastic cooler/ice chest.

4.text: Put the cooler in your car and roll down the windows.

5.text: Wear leather gloves and long sleeves when opening or pouring dry ice.

6.text: Keep unused dry ice in well-ventilated rooms.

7.text: Open doors and windows in a room where dry ice has spilled.

8.text: Leave dry ice in a well-ventilated area at room temperature to dispose of it.

9.text: Do not store dry ice in a completely airtight container.

10.text: Avoid keeping dry ice in cellars, basements, cars, or other poorly ventilated areas.

11.text: Try not to leave dry ice unattended.

12.text: Do not dispose of dry ice in the sewer, sink, toilet, or garbage disposal.
